name: Carriage House Inn

reviews.text: would come back here for every stay from now on staff great hotel very clean and talk about easy access to anything in Branson and the price i would rate 4or5 star for location and friendlyness.
reviews.title: best of branson

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything is as advertised on the site. Personally met will most of the staff and they were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in the deluxe suite and loved it. Very clean, and just an overall pleasant stay. As far as the biscuits and gravy goes, the gravy was amazing, but the biscuits are less than desired. I found that when you eat it though the gravy makes up for any short falls of the biscuit. Also, there is a large selection of doughnuts that are delicious.
reviews.title: Extremely pleased with our stay!

reviews.text: We will continue to stay at this hotel in the years that we visit Branson, MO
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was more than a little concerned about some of the reviews, but this place looked like a match in most areas. Called and spoke to the manager about the reviews and took a chance. What an outstanding choice! King room with jetted tub was great. Room was clean and accessible. Breakfast won't compete with the buffets in town, but met the needs and saved us a bunch of money over the week.
reviews.title: Best in Branson

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Owners were ON-SITE, gracious, friendly, and attentively took care of their customers personally during breakfast. I would absolutely stay here again. Off the main traffic patterns, but great location.
reviews.title: Very clean, friendly staff and a good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Carriage House Inn was the perfect spot for our stay in delightful Branson, MO. The staff was extremely warm, friendly, and welcoming and go above and beyond in making sure your stay is nothing less than ideal. Morning breakfast includes homemade doughnuts which are to die for....and they put them out again during the day for snacks! The location is great for quick access to the theatre district, and the rooms were very comfortable. Carriage House Inn is definitely on our list for a return trip to Branson!
reviews.title: Perfect place!

reviews.text: We have stayed here several times over the last 3 years. We always have clean rooms. Resonable rates and close to Silver Dollar City and attractions. The front desk and staff are helpful and friendly. I woud recommend the Carriage House to anyone coming to Branson. Nice Breakfast. We like the indoor pool which we use in the Spring and Fall.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!!

reviews.text: My only complaint about the Carriage House Inn was that I had to leave. My trip ended and I didn't want to go home. This place is amazing.
reviews.title: Home Away from Home

reviews.text: First of all this place is as clean as you can get. Our room was so nice and clean and spacious. We had a fridge and microwave in our room which was very helpful. The cleaning staff took care of our room on our time, whenever it was convenient for us. The owner of the motel runs the breakfast room. He makes sure everyone knows where everything is, and really makes an effort to get to know all of his guests. By the time we left I felt like we'd been friends with him for a long time. Get ready to have a good time with him...he's one of the friendliest men there is!
reviews.title: Great place!
Good Value
reviews.text: There are I Love Lucy videos playing in the breakfast room in the afternoon in case you want a break from your room and would like to watch something on TV. He also has movies he'll put in for you.

My most recent trip to Branson provided a wonderful stay at the Carriage House Inn. The rooms are very CLEAN, quiet, and well maintained. What a wonderful surprise in this price range!! The staff was very helpful in providing information I needed. My next stay will be with the Carriage House Inn!
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: Rooms were fine, but breakfast needs a big upgrade!!!!!
reviews.title: Nice Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently my Husband and I took our ninty year old Aunt on a weekend vacation to Branson Missouri, We were looking for a handy-cap walk in shower. While looking for a Clean, Comfortable, and Convient Motel to stay, and during our search your Motel was refered to us by another business.
reviews.title: Our stay at Carriage House Inn was a good experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You offered to us the Cleanlyness that we were looking for, as well as the Comfort Level, and the Staff of Carriage House Inn was very friendly, informative, and professional to us and that was much appreciated!
reviews.title: Wonderful, Just Wonderful!

reviews.text: We felt that is was important to take out the time and imform you all of how pleased we were with our stay at Carriage House Inn.
reviews.title: wow what a place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 7 nights at the Carriage House Inn in September and were very pleased with our room and the entire staff. We requested a refrigerator in our room and they delivered one within 5 minutes. Daily housekeeping service was good.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our Stay!

reviews.text: My elderly parents joined us on this trip and spent 3 nights. They were extremely pleased with their room and the staff went out of their way to assist them. We didn't eat breakfast, but my parents did each morning and were more than happy with the food and selection.
reviews.title: Would not recommend

reviews.text: When making our reservations, we requested a smoking room and a 1st floor room for my partents. Upon check-in, we received the exact type of room requested.
reviews.title: Dirty, OLD, smelly, Rude Staff

reviews.text: I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Thanks for a great stay in Branson.
reviews.title: Had a blast in Branson

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay at this hotel after Branson Tourism Center advised us that the hotel we picked off of their web site was no longer available as a choice and recommended this one. The hotel was somewhat clean. The indoor pool was in a separate building from the hotel, when we were there the temps were in the 90's and the pool house was not air conditioned. The chemical fumes were awful. The light switch in the bathroom had a short in it and had to be wiggled to make the light come on. The air conditioner made a knocking noise. The coffee pot in the room has not seen soap and water for quite sometime. We stayed four nights, on the fourth night after being gone all day our room had not been cleaned and serviced. The biscuits and gravy was awful, the lady tending the breakfast room was rude and not friendly. We go to Branson quite frequently and will never stay at the Carriage House Inn again. This was very disappointing for our yearly family vacation.
reviews.title: Not a fan of this place.

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights, associated with a conference. Made the original booking by phone in July but did not think to request (and was not offered) a written confirmation. I did get a reservation code, however. When I arrived the desk clerk verified that the first night's accommodation would be paid by the conference because I was a speaker, and the second night would be billed to my credit card, which was exactly what I expected. However, after the first night I received an invoice under my door stating that my stay was ending that day. When I checked at 8:30 a.m. with the front desk, they had no record of the second night's reservation.
reviews.title: Nice rooms; get your reservation in writing

reviews.text: Because of the conference and other bookings, the only available rooms were two smoking rooms (yecch) or a non-smoking executive suite at more than double the price of the current room... the desk clerk offered to arrange to have one of the smoking rooms "fogged." I was less than delighted with these options, but booked the suite. The desk staff assured me that our luggage would be transferred to the new room; all we needed to do was pack up and leave the luggage in the room.
reviews.title: Very pleased with this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I checked back with the front desk at 11:45 a.m. they checked with their housekeeping staff to see whether the room was ready. It wasn't; they said it would be ready in 15 minutes. I went to the room at 12:15 -- half an hour later -- and there was still someone in it, apparently cleaning.
reviews.title: Will Not Stay Again

reviews.text: I left a key at the desk for my husband to pick up later in the day. He came in around 4:00, picked up the key, and found that the luggage hadn't been transferred. He had to call the front desk to get the luggage moved to the new room. The suite was next door to our original room.
reviews.title: Don't judge a book by it's cover
It's ok but nothing special
reviews.text: The rooms were very pleasant -- quiet, clean, well-appointed. The suite had a jetted tub (most of the instructions on the control panel were in French, though) and a separate sleeping area with sliding doors. Wired Internet service worked in the room, but there was no network cable in the suite; wireless wasn't available. A nice extra touch were the cookies left in the room. However, a room service tray with dishes, linens and food scraps that was present on the floor in front of the ice machine in the elevator lobby on our floor when we arrived in the hotel at 4:00 on Wednesday was still on the floor (and added to with other room service trays) when we left near noon on Friday.

reviews.title: Friendly and helpful staff
reviews.text: The satff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. The Sunday brunch is out of this world! So much to choose from and as much as you can eat. The room was clean and plenty big enough to spread out in. We were carless at this point and it was only a ten minute walk to catch the c-train into the centre.

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay at Calgary's Carriage House Inn! It is by far excellent value for the small amount of money you are paying. It has a lovely, large, deep outdoor pool. It is very nice in the summer. The recently renovated rooms, with opening windows are lovely. There is also stunning cherrywood furniture, offset by a goregous granite and marble bathroom. There is little closet space, although, there is a nice large armoire, which is just as good. The owner, a senior man, is quite often sitting in the lobby, chatting among hotel guests, and he is very friendly, watching over his wonderful operation. Overall, the Carriage House Inn is a 5 STAR hotel!! :>

reviews.title: outstamding service,staff,restaurant
reviews.text: We have been staying at this hotel each year on our annual visits, for the past 15 years....won't even consider any other...they have continually kept a well-run business and know how to keep customers returning...a favorite with the locals who want excellent food in their restaurant and bakery. Very elogant!

description: With its beautiful Victorian-style architecture and cozy interior, the Carriage House Inn will make sure you're more than comfortable, and the friendly and knowledgable staff will make you feel right at home and make sure your stay in Branson is nothing less than perfect. Enjoy a daily complimentary deluxe continental breakfast, a heated indoor pool, complimentary high-speed wireless internet access in your room, and a meeting room for any business or family needs. Each room comes equipped with a coffee maker, iron, ironing board, clock, table & chairs or desk and chairs. The beds are Sealy Posturepedic Plush and very comfortable. Adjoining rooms with two queens in each are available for your convience.
